intro: Achaemenes, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has woody stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Achaemenes is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots and a thick cuticle to reduce water loss. Its leaves are often narrow and hairy, further aiding in water conservation.
